poem:
**Pynchon's Party**  

In the haze of Mulligan's dawn,  
forty hours stretch like elastic yawns,  
where wacky names dance in a cacophony,  
and Pynchon's past echoes in melody.  
We drift through memories in V-formation,  
an inherent vice in literary creation.  
Aficionados peer through his kaleidoscope,  
finding every flaw in a hopeful scope.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From V to Vineland and Inherent Vice: Thomas Pynchon’s books – ranked! 9 Slow Learner (1984) A collection of early short stories that is chiefly of interest for the introduction, in which the author spells out why he thinks they fail. Pynchon does not spare himself but, unfortunately, he is right. For aficionados only. Typical line “Downstairs, Meatball Mulligan’s lease-breaking party was moving into its 40th hour.”Pynchon tropes Wacky names, pastiche songs 8 Against the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
